other_tests.findings: Patient with stage II PBC showed worsening liver disease, portal venous thrombus, and was heterozygous for factor V Leiden mutation.
other_tests.changes_over_time: After starting warfarin, patient’s ascites and lower extremity edema disappeared, serum albumin increased to 37 g/L after 6 months, and they remained well for 7 years.

other_tests.findings: Second patient with stage II PBC progressing to cirrhosis and developing left leg deep vein thrombosis.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Six months after starting warfarin, her albumin increased to 38 g/L and she has been well for 3 years.

other_tests.findings: Serum albumin level was 41 g/L; alkaline phosphatase 94 kat/L; ALT 32 U/L; bilirubin 13.7 µmol/L; platelet count 157 x 10^9 cells/L for the first patient.
Serum albumin level was 38 g/L; alkaline phosphatase 98 kat/L; ALT 33 U/L; bilirubin 13.7 µmol/L; platelet count 81 x 10^9 cells/L for the second patient.
